TITLE: World population expected to increase to more than 7.9 billion on New Year’s Day; nearly 1% uptick from 2022
SUMMARY: By New Year's Day, the world population is expected to reach 7,942,645,086 people after a .94% increase from January 2022.

TITLE: Taliban: Kabul checkpoint bomb blast kills, wounds several
SUMMARY: A bomb near a checkpoint at Kabul's military airport killed and wounded "several" on Sunday morning, according to a Taliban official.

TITLE: Brazil's Silva sworn in, pledges to rebuild country, hold outgoing Bolsonaro admin accountable
SUMMARY: Brazil's Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva was sworn-in as president, promising to rebuild the country and hold members of his predecessor's administration accountable.

TITLE: NATO chief calls on allies to stockpile weapons for Ukraine: Report
SUMMARY: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg called on NATO allies to stock up on weapons to supply Ukraine, to fight off attacks from Russia.

TITLE: Mexican border prison attack leaves 14 people dead, more than a dozen injured
SUMMARY: An attack on a state prison in the Mexican town of Ciudad Juarez left 10 guards and four inmates killed, the state prosecutor's office said in a statement.

TITLE: Crowds gather as Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI's body lies in state at Vatican
SUMMARY: Thousands of people waited for hours in a long line to view the body of Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI as his body lies in state at the Vatican in Rome.

TITLE: Biblical site where Jesus healed blind man excavated for public view: 'Affirms Scripture'
SUMMARY: Amid efforts to cancel Jerusalem's biblical heritage for Christians and Jews, the opening of the Pool of Siloam reaffirms the rich history of the Bible in the capital of Israel.

TITLE: At least 4 dead after helicopters collide on the Gold Coast near Sea World in Australia
SUMMARY: Two helicopters collided on New Year's Day in Australia near a Sea World theme park. At least four people are dead after one helicopter clipped another.

TITLE: Russian drone swarm continues New Year assault on Kyiv
SUMMARY: A swarm of Russian kamikaze drones harassed Kyiv early Monday morning, with air-raid sirens blaring and at least two explosions being heard in the heart of the Ukrainian city.

TITLE: Kim Jong Un fires North Korea’s top military official
SUMMARY: North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un fired his top military chief during an annual end-of-year meeting of the country's top leadership last week.

TITLE: Brazil's Lula inaugurated as new president after Bolsonaro reportedly fled to Florida home of MMA fighter
SUMMARY: Brazilian leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva was inaugurated as president Sunday after outgoing Jair Bolsonaro reportedly fled to the United States and is seeking refuge in Orlando.

TITLE: Russia admits heavy casualties in Ukrainian strike on occupied Donetsk region; 63 Russian soldiers killed
SUMMARY: While Russia continues its New Year's bombardment of Kyiv, Moscow admitted to heavy casualties in the Donetsk region, where anywhere between 63 to some 400 Russian soldiers were killed.

TITLE: Scandals in the UK: Boris Johnson's 'partygate,' Prince Andrew's demise and other misdeeds
SUMMARY: 2022 saw several high-profile scandals hit the United Kingdom, most notably the downfall of former Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Other well known people involved in scandals included Prince Andrew and Boris Becker.

TITLE: Vietnam rescuers race to save boy trapped down 115-foot concrete hole since New Year's Eve
SUMMARY: Hundreds of rescuers -- now with federal support -- worked again Monday to try to save a 10-year-old boy who felt down a narrow concrete shaft at a construction site on New Year's Eve.

TITLE: France makes condoms free for everyone younger than 26, emergency contraception free for all women
SUMMARY: Staring on Jan. 1, 2023, condoms are now free in French pharmacies for everyone younger than 26 years old as part of an effort to curb sexually transmitted diseases.

TITLE: Chinese travelers facing COVID-19 testing requirements from more countries amid outbreak
SUMMARY: At least a dozen countries have implemented testing requirements and other containment measures on Chinese travelers amid an explosive COVID-19 outbreak.

TITLE: More than 60,000 come to view Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI's body on first day
SUMMARY: Italian police predicted 30,000 visitors to view Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI's body. By the end of the evening, 65,000 people passed through St. Peter's Basilica.

TITLE: Iran’s Ayatollah Khamenei celebrates new year by praising Soleimani, terrorists
SUMMARY: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader, celebrated the new year by praising slain Gen. Qassem Soleimani, who was responsible for the deaths of hundreds of U.S. service members.

TITLE: Kim Jong Un: North Korea must 'overwhelmingly beef up' military, nuclear arsenal
SUMMARY: North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un announced on New Years Day that he would be seeking to 'overwhelmingly beef up' the nation's military capabilities.

TITLE: Ukraine: Suspected Banksy mural thief could get 12 years in prison
SUMMARY: The man behind an operation to steal a Banksy mural in Hostomel, Ukraine, outside of Kyiv, faces up to 12 years in prison if convicted, a report says.

TITLE: Ukraine liberates 40% of territory occupied by Russia since Feb 2022: official
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces have liberated roughly 40% of the territory Russia occupied following its invasion, including 28% of the regions Moscow still occupies.

TITLE: WATCH: Drone footage shows tiger shark swimming several feet from beachgoers - and they don't know it
SUMMARY: An Instagram account caught the footage using a drone: the owner showed the video to one of the unsuspecting swimmers, who was "stunned" at how close the shark swam.

TITLE: Zelenskyy warns Russia planning ‘prolonged’ attack with Iranian Shahed drones
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that Kyiv has gained intelligence that Russia is planning a 'prolonged' attack using Iranian supplied Shahed drones.

TITLE: Pope Benedict's last words, according to his bedside nurse
SUMMARY: Pope Benedict XVI's last words, spoken in Italian on his death bed on Dec. 31, were recorded by his attending nurse, according to Vatican reports.

TITLE: South Korea in talks to manage US nukes amid growing threat from North Korea: report
SUMMARY: President Biden denied reports that the U.S. and South Korea were engaged in nuclear weapons management talks, something South Korea insisted was a miscommunication.

TITLE: China's new foreign minister praises Americans, strikes friendly tone
SUMMARY: The Chinese Communist Party has promoted its ambassador to the U.S., Qin Gang, to the position of foreign minister, striking a surprisingly friendly tone.

TITLE: Russian outrage grows after strike kills dozens of troops in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian nationalists and lawmakers are expressing outrage after the deaths of 63 Russian soldiers in a New Year's Eve strike on a Russian military barracks in Ukraine.

TITLE: German doctor sentenced to over 2 years in prison for illegally issuing mask exemptions during the pandemic
SUMMARY: A German doctor was sentenced to nearly three years in prison for illegally issuing mask exemptions to people during the pandemic. The doctor's office assistant was also fined.

TITLE: Hong Kong Cardinal Joseph Zen to be allowed to attend funeral for Pope Benedict XVI in Vatican City
SUMMARY: Cardinal Joseph Zen of Hong Kong will be allowed to attend the funeral for Pope Benedict XVI. Zen attended court to apply for a leave from his city.

TITLE: Blinken reminds Israel Biden admin committed to 'two-state solution' following Netanyahu appointment
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken reminded Israel of the Biden administration's commitment to a two-state solution with their Palestinian neighbors following the appointment of Eli Cohen as foreign minister.

TITLE: Mexican journalist attacked on first day of 2023 after 2022 was deadliest year for journalists in decades
SUMMARY: A Mexican journalist was attacked on the first day of 2023 after 2022 saw the deadliest year on record for Mexican journalists in decades.

TITLE: China blasts 'unacceptable' COVID-19 travel restrictions, claims political motivations for new rules
SUMMARY: China has changed how it reports cases and deaths related to COVID-19, with officials no longer counting asymptomatic results as positive and only certain deaths as covid-related.

TITLE: 4 Nigerian security officials killed in car bomb targeting former governor in Imo State
SUMMARY: A car bombing in southeast Nigeria killed four security officials. The attack, which took place in Imo State, was aimed at former governor Ikedi Ohakim.

TITLE: Uganda police charge organizer of New Year’s celebrations with murder
SUMMARY: The death toll in a stampede that occurred at a shopping mall in Uganda’s capital has risen to 10. The Uganda police have charged the organizer of the New Year celebrations with murder.

TITLE: Ugandan soldier fatally shoots 3 colleagues who were part of force guarding Somalia's international airport
SUMMARY: A soldier for Uganda's military fatally shot three colleagues in Somalia. The soldier was a part of the force guarding the international airport in Somalia.

TITLE: Germany records highest annual inflation rate in over 70 years
SUMMARY: Germany's Federal Statistic Office announced that the country recorded its highest full-year inflation rate in more than 70 years. Germany's annual inflation in 2022 reached 7.9%.

TITLE: Mexico prison break: Shootout leaves 7 dead as authorities hunt inmates who escaped near Texas border
SUMMARY: Seven people, including two state investigators, have been killed in a shootout in Mexico, a report says, following a deadly prison break that unfolded near the U.S.-Mexico border.

TITLE: Syria says Israeli airstrike shut down Damascus airport, killing 2 soldiers and wounding 2 others
SUMMARY: Syria says that an Israeli missile strike temporarily shut down the international airport in Damascus and killed two people while injuring two others.

TITLE: Poland asks UN to step in as it pushes Germany for WWII reparations
SUMMARY: Poland on Tuesday appealed to the U.N. chief to step in and assist Warsaw as it looks to secure reparations from Germany amid alleged resistance from Berlin.

TITLE: Insiders claim King Charles still open to reconciliation with son Prince Harry: report
SUMMARY: Sources close to King Charles III have said the monarch remains open to reconciliation with his son, Prince Harry, despite ongoing public tension.

TITLE: State Department calls on China to be more transparent on current COVID-19 surge, virus' origins
SUMMARY: State Department spokesperson Ned Price called on China to be more transparent about the current COVID-19 outbreak and origins of the virus on Tuesday.

TITLE: US base in Syria hit with 2 rockets following 3rd anniversary of Soleimani killing
SUMMARY: Two rockets struck a U.S. base in northeast Syria following the third anniversary of the killing of Iranian military leader Qassem Solemani by a U.S. drone strike.

TITLE: Putin deploys frigate to Atlantic Ocean armed with hypersonic Zircon cruise missiles
SUMMARY: A Russian ship called the Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, which is armed with hypersonic cruise missiles, has deployed to the Atlantic Ocean Wednesday.

TITLE: Russia blames banned cellphone use for New Year's Day strike on military barracks as death toll climbs
SUMMARY: Russia appeared to blame its own troops for the deadly strike on military barracks in Makiyivka on New Years Day, saying banned cellphone used alerted Ukrainian troops to the barrack's location.

TITLE: Japan offering families 1 million yen per child to leave Tokyo for rural areas
SUMMARY: Japanese lawmakers have boosted an incentive program that will now provide 1 million yen, $7,500, per child to families who leave Tokyo for rural areas.

TITLE: Pope Benedict's secretary soon to publish inside story of his papacy, 'Nothing but the Truth'
SUMMARY: Archbishop Georg Gänswein, prefect of the papal household and personal secretary to Pope Benedict XVI, will be publishing an inside account of the late pontiff's time at the Vatican.

TITLE: French police investigate allegations of sexual assault against former archbishop of Paris
SUMMARY: The archbishop of Paris has been accused of sexually assaulting a woman who is under legal protection. Authorities in France are investigating the allegations.

TITLE: Ukraine decries Israel, Russia chat and suggests 'change of policy' amid new Netanyahu admin
SUMMARY: Ukraine's ambassador to Israel condemned a call this week between the Russian and Israeli foreign ministries and suggested the first of such calls since Russia's invasion of Ukraine indicated a change in policy.

TITLE: Nazi treasure map available to public, reveals possible location of gold, diamond trove
SUMMARY: News of "Nazi gold" in Poland and Iceland in recent years set off a frenzy for treasure hunters, but some fear that the Dutch trove may have already been found and cleared.

TITLE: Czech government approves bill aimed at 2% GDP spending on military amid Russia's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Czech government announced that a bill was approved to bring defense spending to 2% of the GDP. They will only spend 1.52% of the GDP this year but will reach the 2% goal in 2024.

TITLE: Zelenskyy warns Russia will 'throw everything they have' in attempt to turn war around
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned in an overnight address that Russia is planning to ramp up its aggression and will "throw everything they have" in an attempt to turn the war around.

TITLE: Ahead of funeral, Pope Francis praises Benedict for his 'gentle thought’
SUMMARY: Pope Francis praised the late Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI for his "gentle thought" on Wednesday while speaking at the Vatican during his weekly general audience.

TITLE: European Union's natural gas storage levels stand at nearly 84% despite Russian attempts to choke off supplies
SUMMARY: After stocking up on gas last year, the EU's natural gas storage levels stand at nearly 84%. This comes despite the fact that Russia has attempted to cut off natural gas supply.

TITLE: Fight over Jerusalem's Temple Mount holy site: Why is it so important to Jews, Muslims and Christians?
SUMMARY: Just days into the new Israeli Prime Minister’s Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, an international row erupted over the visit to the Temple Mount by one of his ministers.

TITLE: Village north of Mexico City spring water well explodes in flames
SUMMARY: A spring water well broke out in flames last week in a Mexican village. People were complaining about the smell of gas for weeks and think that fuel thieves could have caused the leak.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: Memories of performing for Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI
SUMMARY: Fox News' chief religion correspondent Lauren Green, who is covering the funeral Benedict XVI from the Vatican, reflects on her meeting the late pope emeritus.

TITLE: Putin operatives trying to turn Germans against Ukraine war: report
SUMMARY: Factions of far-right groups and pro-Putin operatives have reportedly combined forces in Germany to push Berlin to end its support for Ukraine's defense against Russia's invasion.

TITLE: China warns US not to cross 'red line' on Taiwan, use 'salami tactics'
SUMMARY: China is warning the U.S. not to use "salami tactics" and stop challenging Beijing's "red line" on Taiwan, which it regards as its own territory.

TITLE: First 'gender-queer' priest in Church of England expresses desire for 'normalizing' identity among children
SUMMARY: Rev. Bingo Allison, a self-described non-binary gender-queer priest in the Church of England, has publicly expressed a hope of "normalizing" LGBTQ behavior among children.

TITLE: Iran sentences two teens to death for waging 'enmity against God' in protest against regime
SUMMARY: Iran issued two death sentences to teenagers this week who were involved in the nationwide demonstrations and deemed to have waged "enmity against God."

TITLE: Vietnamese boy, 10, dead after falling into 115-foot concrete hole
SUMMARY: A Vietnamese boy trapped down a 115-foot concrete hole at a construction site since New Year's Eve was declared dead Wednesday, but the boy's body has not yet been recovered.

TITLE: US reopens visa, consular services at Cuban embassy for first time since 'Havana Syndrome' incidents
SUMMARY: The American embassy in Havana, Cuba, has reopened its visa and consular services Wednesday for the first time since a series of health incidents dubbed the "Havana Syndrome."

TITLE: Tokyo to give 5,000 yen in monthly benefits per child
SUMMARY: The Tokyo Government is planning on offering households with children aged 18 or younger in the capital a monthly handout of about 5,000 yen, or 38 dollars, per child.

TITLE: China undercounting COVID-19 cases and deaths, WHO says: 'We still do not have complete data'
SUMMARY: China is underrepresenting the extent of the COVID-19 surge that is ripping through the country, a World Health Organization official said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Iran outraged after French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo publishes cartoons mocking Khamenei
SUMMARY: French satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo has published a series of offensive cartoons depicting Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

TITLE: Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI funeral mass to be held in Saint Peter's Square, presided over by Pope Francis
SUMMARY: Pope Francis will preside over the funeral mass for Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI on Thursday. The Vatican announced Pope Benedict's death on Saturday, Jan. 1, 2023.

TITLE: Anonymous claims Serbia is 'Putin's puppet,' Russia looks to expand war in Europe and 'distract the West'
SUMMARY: Kosovo closed the border to Serbia after ethnic Serbians created a blockade and fired at authorities, but Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic helped to relax the situation.

TITLE: Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI funeral mass held in Saint Peter's Square, presided over by Pope Francis
SUMMARY: Pope Francis will preside over the funeral mass for Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI on Thursday. The Vatican announced Pope Benedict's death on Saturday, Jan. 1, 2023.

TITLE: Pope Benedict XVI's funeral: Pope Francis remembers the dead pontiff's life, legacy and courage
SUMMARY: Pope Francis presided over former Pope Benedict XVI's funeral mass in St. Peter's Square Thursday, remembering his life, legacy, and courage for resigning from the papacy.

TITLE: Biden considers sending Bradley Fighting Vehicles as Ukraine pleads for tanks
SUMMARY: President Biden said the U.S. is considering sending Kyiv Bradley Fighting Vehicles as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy continues to request tanks for tough fight on eastern front.

TITLE: Putin orders temporary ceasefire in Ukraine in observation of Orthodox Christmas
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin called on his defense minister to order for a temporary ceasefire in Ukraine in observation of Orthodox Christmas.

TITLE: Russia's Wagner chief frees first round of convicts who traded jail time for war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Head of Russia' mercenary Wagner Group released the first round of convicts who traded jail time to join the war in Ukraine.

TITLE: COVID infected Chinese tourist caught in South Korea after fleeing quarantine center
SUMMARY: A Chinese man was able to evade South Korean authorities for two days after fleeing mandatory quarantine when he tested positive for COVID-19 upon arrival in the country.

TITLE: El Chapo's son has been captured in Sinaloa in Mexican military operation: report
SUMMARY: Mexican authorities arrested Ovidio Guzman, the son of El Chapo and the leader of Los Chapitos, in Sinaloa on Thursday.

TITLE: Germany working on legislation to enable use of underground carbon storage technology
SUMMARY: Germany is looking into enabling the use of underground carbon storage. The country's climate minister feels there could be a "new market" for carbon capture and storage.

TITLE: Third Australian cruise in weeks turns into 'nightmare' after fungus outbreak prevents entry into New Zealand
SUMMARY: Over the past few weeks, passengers on 3 cruise ships had their plans derailed when the ships were denied entry into New Zealand due to environmental standards.

TITLE: State Dept. offers $10 million reward for info on 2020 US base attack in Kenya that killed 3 Americans
SUMMARY: The State Department marked the third anniversary of the al-Shabaab attack on the Manda Bay base in Kenya by offering a $10 million reward to those who have information on those involved.

TITLE: Pope Benedict XVI laid to rest under St. Peter's Basilica in private ceremony
SUMMARY: The late Pope Benedict XVI was laid to rest after days of public mourning and prayer in a private ceremony burying him in the crypt under St. Peter's Basilica.

TITLE: French Defense Ministry expected to send armored combat vehicles to Ukraine
SUMMARY: Ukraine is expecting to receive armored combat vehicles from the French Defense Ministry. The countries' officials will meet to discuss a delivery timetable and training.

TITLE: Hong Kong ends year-long hamster import ban: report
SUMMARY: Several countries culled hundreds of thousands of mink in 2020 after determining that the populations at farms had COVID-19 infections and risked transmission to other animals.

TITLE: Mexican authorities confirm arrest of son of drug kingpin ‘El Chapo’ after 6-month interagency investigation
SUMMARY: A six-month investigation involving multiple agencies led to Thursday's arrest of Ovidio Guzman Lopez, the son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman.

TITLE: Mexican cartel leader killed in shootout with police after escaping prison
SUMMARY: Mexican authorities say a drug cartel leader died Thursday after a shootout with police following a violent escape from prison earlier in the week.

TITLE: Taiwan officials say 17 Chinese military aircraft, 3 ships, entered space close to island
SUMMARY: Taiwanese officials say that 17 Chinese military aircraft, in addition to three ships, entered an area that is close to the island on Friday morning.

TITLE: China COVID crisis: Beijing hospital runs out of beds, families burn bodies in streets as deaths spike
SUMMARY: Some videos on Twitter show families allegedly burning the bodies of loved ones in the streets of Chinese cities as funeral homes struggle to handle the surge in COVID deaths.

TITLE: White House hopeful war with China over Taiwan 'never comes to pass': report
SUMMARY: White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said he believes war with China over Taiwan can be avoided even as tensions remain high in the region.

TITLE: Sinaloa, Mexico engulfed by violence, chaos after El Chapo son arrest, ahead of Biden visit to country
SUMMARY: The region of Mexico where Ovidio Guzmán -- the son of jailed drug cartel kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán -- was taken into custody has now been hit with violence.

TITLE: Dozens of Christian graves toppled, defaced in historic Jerusalem cemetery: 'Clear hate crime'
SUMMARY: Roughly 30 Christian graves were vandalized inside a historic cemetery in Jerusalem, and local authorities described the desecration as a "clear hate crime" that has led to two arrests.

TITLE: 10-year-old Australian boy remains in coma following helicopter crash that killed 4
SUMMARY: An accident involving two helicopters killed four people in Australia earlier this week. A 10-year-old boy who was involved in the crash is still in a coma.

TITLE: WATCH: Safari tourists chased by rhinos in bone-chilling videos at Indian parks
SUMMARY: Two videos from Dec. 2022 in India show rhinos charging after safari tourists in an effort to defend its territory, each time sending the tourists into a wild panic.

TITLE: Chad's government foils attempt to destabilize country, undermine the constitution
SUMMARY: Eleven people in Chad attempted to destabilize the country and undermine the constitution. Chad's government was able to foil the attempt.

TITLE: Building collapse in northern Iraqi city killing 3, injures 9
SUMMARY: A building under construction collapsed Thursday in Iraq's northern city of Mosul, killing three and injuring nine. Workers were casting the roof of the building with cement.

TITLE: Greeks celebrate Epiphany with blessings of the water after 2 years of COVID restrictions
SUMMARY: Greeks celebrated the Epiphany, also known as Three Kings Day, after two years of COVID-19 restrictions. The celebrations included blessings of the water ceremonies.

TITLE: Mexican authorities say 10 military personnel, 19 cartel members killed in raid to arrest El Chapo's son
SUMMARY: Mexican authorities released more details about a Thursday morning raid that erupted into a small war as police successfully arrested the son of Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán.

TITLE: Sinaloa, Mexico, engulfed by violence, chaos after El Chapo son arrest, ahead of Biden visit to country
SUMMARY: The region of Mexico where Ovidio Guzmán — the son of jailed drug cartel kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán — was taken into custody has now been hit with violence.

TITLE: Israeli ambassador slams UN for meeting over visit to Temple Mount
SUMMARY: Supporters of Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir stress that he did not walk on the site of the Holy of Holies and did not pray, thereby avoiding any violations of policy.

TITLE: Russia fighting continues at 'routine level' despite Christmas ceasefire
SUMMARY: Russia's war effort in Ukraine has persisted at a 'routine level' despite Russian President Vladimir Putin's order for a ceasefire over Orthodox Christmas.

TITLE: Zelenskyy urges Russian citizens to oppose war after rejecting Putin ceasefire: 'end your state's aggression'
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Voldymyr Zelenskyy rejected Vladimir Putin's calls for a ceasefire and instead appealed to Russian citizens to oppose his deadly war.
